## Taylor Series: A Function's Best Friend

A Taylor series breaks down a function into an infinite sum of simpler terms, kind of like a mathematical recipe. It uses the function's derivatives (how it changes) at a single point.

The more terms you include, the closer the Taylor series approximates the original function, like building a puzzle with more pieces.

When the Taylor series has a finite number of terms, it's called a Taylor polynomial. These polynomials are good approximations of the function, especially when you use more terms.
